translations.english_saheeh: When the Occurrence occurs,
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. When the Event (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) befalls.
translations.english_rwwad: When the Inevitable Event comes to pass,

translations.english_saheeh: There is, at its occurrence, no denial.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And there can be no denial of its befalling.
translations.english_rwwad: there will be none to deny its occurrence;

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1608]- According to their deeds rather than wealth and social position, as is the case in this world.

translations.english_saheeh: It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].[1608]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Bringing low (some - those who will enter Hell) Exalting (others - those who will enter Paradise). [Tafsir Ibn Kathir]
translations.english_rwwad: it will bring some low and raise others up.

translations.english_saheeh: When the earth is shaken with convulsion
translations.english_hilali_khan: When the earth will be shaken with a terrible shake.
translations.english_rwwad: When the earth will be shaken violently,

translations.english_saheeh: And the mountains are broken down, crumbling
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the mountains will be powdered to dust,
translations.english_rwwad: and the mountains crushed to pieces,

translations.english_saheeh: And become dust dispersing,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So that they will become floating dust particles.
translations.english_rwwad: and turn to scattered dust,

translations.english_saheeh: And you become [of] three kinds:
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you (all) will be in three groups.
translations.english_rwwad: then you are sorted into three groups:

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1609]- i.e., those given their records in their right hand and who are destined for Paradise.

translations.english_saheeh: Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?[1609]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So those on the Right Hand (i.e. those who will be given their Records in their right hands) - how (fortunate) will be those on the Right Hand! (As a respect for them, because they will enter Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: the people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right!

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1610]- i.e., those given their records in their left hand and who are destined for Hell.

translations.english_saheeh: And the companions of the left - what are companions of the left?[1610]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those on the Left Hand (i.e. those who will be given their Record in their left hands) - how (unfortunate) will be those on the Left Hand! (As a disgrace for them, because they will enter Hell).
translations.english_rwwad: The people of the left – how miserable will be the people of the left!

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1611]- The words can also be understood as a complete sentence, i.e., "The forerunners [in good deeds] are the forerunners [in entering Paradise]."

translations.english_saheeh: And the forerunners, the forerunners[1611] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those foremost [(in Islâmic Faith of Monotheism and in performing righteous deeds) in the life of this world on the very first call for to embrace Islâm] will be foremost (in Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: And the forerunners [in faith] are the forerunners [in Paradise].

translations.english_saheeh: Those are the ones brought near [to Allāh]
translations.english_hilali_khan: These will be the nearest (to Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: They are the nearest ones [to Allah],

translations.english_saheeh: In the Gardens of Pleasure,
translations.english_hilali_khan: In the Gardens of Delight (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: in Gardens of Bliss,

translations.english_saheeh: A [large] company of the former peoples
translations.english_hilali_khan: A multitude of those (foremost) will be from the first generations (who embraced Islâm).
translations.english_rwwad: many from the early generations,

translations.english_saheeh: And a few of the later peoples,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And a few of those (foremost) will be from the later generations.
translations.english_rwwad: and a few from the later generations.

translations.english_saheeh: On thrones woven [with ornament],
translations.english_hilali_khan: (They will be) on thrones woven with gold and precious stones.
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be seated] on jeweled couches,

translations.english_saheeh: Reclining on them, facing each other.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Reclining thereon, face to face.
translations.english_rwwad: reclining on them, facing one another.

translations.english_saheeh: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Immortal boys will go around them (serving),
translations.english_rwwad: They will be served by immortal youths

phonetic: 56.18 Bi'akwābin Wa 'Abārīqa Wa Ka'sin Min Ma`īnin

translations.english_saheeh: With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -
translations.english_hilali_khan: With cups, and jugs, and a glass of flowing wine,
translations.english_rwwad: with cups, pitchers, and glasses [of wine] from a flowing spring,

translations.english_saheeh: No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Wherefrom they will get neither any aching of the head, nor any intoxication.
translations.english_rwwad: which will neither cause any headache nor intoxication,

translations.english_saheeh: And fruit of what they select
translations.english_hilali_khan: And with fruit that they may choose.
translations.english_rwwad: along with fruits of their choice,

translations.english_saheeh: And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And with the flesh of fowls that they desire.
translations.english_rwwad: and flesh of birds that they may desire.

translations.english_saheeh: And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (there will be) Hûr (fair females) with wide, lovely eyes (as wives for "Al-Muttaqûn" - the pious - See V. 2:2),
translations.english_rwwad: And [they will have] maidens of wide gorgeous eyes,

translations.english_saheeh: The likenesses of pearls well-protected,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Like unto preserved pearls.
translations.english_rwwad: like pristine pearls,

translations.english_saheeh: As reward for what they used to do.
translations.english_hilali_khan: A reward for what they used to do.
translations.english_rwwad: as a reward for what they used to do.

arabic_text: لَا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمًا
phonetic: 56.25 Lā Yasma`ūna Fīhā Laghwan Wa Lā Ta'thīmāan

translations.english_saheeh: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -
translations.english_hilali_khan: No Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk) will they hear therein, nor any sinful speech (like backbiting).
translations.english_rwwad: They will not hear therein any idle talk or sinful speech,

translations.english_saheeh: Only a saying [of] peace, peace.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But only the saying of: Salâm! Salâm! (greetings with peace)![1]
translations.english_rwwad: except the words of peace, peace.

translations.english_saheeh: The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those on the Right Hand - how (fortunate) will be those on the Right Hand?
translations.english_rwwad: The people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right!

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (They will be) among thornless lote-trees,
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be] amid thornless lote trees,

translations.english_saheeh: And [banana] trees layered [with fruit].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And among Talh (banana-trees) with fruits piled one above another,
translations.english_rwwad: and clusters of bananas,

translations.english_saheeh: And shade extended.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in shade long-extended,
translations.english_rwwad: and shade long-extended,

translations.english_saheeh: And water poured out
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by water flowing constantly,
translations.english_rwwad: and flowing water,

translations.english_saheeh: And fruit, abundant [and varied],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And fruit in plenty,
translations.english_rwwad: and abundant fruit –

translations.english_saheeh: Neither limited [to season] nor forbidden,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Whose supply is not cut off (by change of season), nor are they out of reach,
translations.english_rwwad: neither ceasing nor restricted –

translations.english_saheeh: And [upon] beds raised high.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And on couches or thrones, raised high.
translations.english_rwwad: and mattresses raised high [on beds].

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We have produced them [i.e., the women of Paradise] in a [new] creation
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We have created them (maidens) of special creation.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We have perfectly created them [their spouses],

translations.english_saheeh: And made them virgins,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And made them virgins.
translations.english_rwwad: and have made them virgins,

translations.english_saheeh: Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Loving (their husbands only), (and) of equal age.
translations.english_rwwad: loving and of equal age,

translations.english_saheeh: For the companions of the right [who are]
translations.english_hilali_khan: For those on the Right Hand.
translations.english_rwwad: for the people of the right,

translations.english_saheeh: A company of the former peoples
translations.english_hilali_khan: A multitude of those (on the Right Hand) will be from the first generation (who embraced Islâm).
translations.english_rwwad: many from the earlier generations,

translations.english_saheeh: And a company of the later peoples.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And a multitude of those (on the Right Hand) will be from the later generations.
translations.english_rwwad: and many from the later generations.

translations.english_saheeh: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those on the Left Hand - how (unfortunate) will be those on the Left Hand?
translations.english_rwwad: And the people of the left – how wretched will be the people of the left!

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water
translations.english_hilali_khan: In fierce hot wind and boiling water,
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be] in scorching wind and scalding water,

translations.english_saheeh: And a shade of black smoke,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And shadow of black smoke,
translations.english_rwwad: in the shade of black smoke,

translations.english_saheeh: Neither cool nor beneficial.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (That shadow) neither cool, nor (even) pleasant,
translations.english_rwwad: neither cool nor refreshing.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, before that, they indulged in luxury,
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, they used to be in luxuries before,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1612]- i.e., shirk (association with Allāh) or disbelief.

translations.english_saheeh: And they used to persist in the great violation,[1612]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And were persisting in great sin (joining partners in worship along with Allâh, committing murder and other crimes)[2]
translations.english_rwwad: and persisted in the gravest sin [of polytheism].

arabic_text: وَكَانُواْ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ
phonetic: 56.47 Wa Kānū Yaqūlūna 'A'idhā Mitnā Wa Kunnā Turābāan Wa `Ižāmāan 'A'innā Lamab`ūthūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they used to say: "When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be resurrected?
translations.english_rwwad: They used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, will we really be raised again?

translations.english_saheeh: And our forefathers [as well]?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And also our forefathers?"
translations.english_rwwad: And our forefathers as well?”

translations.english_saheeh: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, the former and later peoples
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "(Yes) verily, those of old, and those of later times.
translations.english_rwwad: Say, [O Prophet], “Indeed, the former and later generations

translations.english_saheeh: Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "All will surely be gathered together for appointed Meeting of a known Day.
translations.english_rwwad: will be gathered on a predetermined Day.

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then moreover, verily you the erring-ones, the deniers (of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Then you, O misguided deniers,

translations.english_saheeh: Will be eating from trees of zaqqūm
translations.english_hilali_khan: "You verily will eat of the trees of Zaqqûm.
translations.english_rwwad: will surely eat from the tree of zaqqūm,

translations.english_saheeh: And filling with it your bellies
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then you will fill your bellies therewith,
translations.english_rwwad: filling your bellies with it,

translations.english_saheeh: And drinking on top of it from scalding water.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And drink boiling water on top of it.
translations.english_rwwad: and drinking scalding water on top of it,

translations.english_saheeh: And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And you will drink (that) like thirsty camels!"
translations.english_rwwad: drinking like thirsty camels do.”

translations.english_saheeh: That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That will be their entertainment on the Day of Recompense!
translations.english_rwwad: This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment.

translations.english_saheeh: We have created you, so why do you not believe?
translations.english_hilali_khan: We created you: then why do you believe not?
translations.english_rwwad: It is We Who created you; will you not then believe [in resurrection]?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1613]- i.e., semen, which contains the potential for human life.

translations.english_saheeh: Have you seen that which you emit?[1613]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then tell Me (about) the (human) semen that you emit.
translations.english_rwwad: Have you thought about the semen that you emit?

translations.english_saheeh: Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is it you who create it (i.e. make this semen into a perfect human being), or are We the Creator?
translations.english_rwwad: Is it you who create it, or is it We Who are the Creators?

arabic_text: نَحۡنُ قَدَّرۡنَا بَيۡنَكُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ
phonetic: 56.60 Naĥnu Qaddarnā Baynakumu Al-Mawta Wa Mā Naĥnu Bimasbūqīna

translations.english_saheeh: We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone
translations.english_hilali_khan: We have decreed death to you all, and We are not outstripped,
translations.english_rwwad: We have ordained death among you, and nothing can overcome us

arabic_text: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمۡثَٰلَكُمۡ وَنُنشِئَكُمۡ فِي مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 56.61 `Alá 'An Nubaddila 'Amthālakum Wa Nunshi'akum Fī Mā Lā Ta`lamūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1614]- An alternative meaning has also been given:  "...in that We will replace the likes of you [with others upon the earth] and create you [in the Hereafter] in that which you do not know."

translations.english_saheeh: In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.[1614]
translations.english_hilali_khan: To transfigure you and create you in (forms) that you know not.
translations.english_rwwad: from transforming you and recreating you in forms that you do not know.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتُمُ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ فَلَوۡلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
phonetic: 56.62 Wa Laqad `Alimtumu An-Nash'ata Al-'Ūlá Falawlā Tadhkkarūna

translations.english_saheeh: And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, you have already known the first form of creation (i.e. the creation of Adam): why then do you not remember (or take heed)?
translations.english_rwwad: You are well aware of the first creation; why do you not then take heed?

translations.english_saheeh: And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then tell Me about the seed that you sow in the ground.
translations.english_rwwad: Have you thought about what you sow?

translations.english_saheeh: Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is it you that make it grow, or are We the Grower?
translations.english_rwwad: Is it you who cause it grow, or is it We Who make it grow?

arabic_text: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ حُطَٰمٗا فَظَلۡتُمۡ تَفَكَّهُونَ
phonetic: 56.65 Law Nashā'u Laja`alnāhu Ĥuţāmāan Fažalaltum Tafakkahūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1615]- At what had happened or remain in a state of shock.  Another meaning is "in regret".

translations.english_saheeh: If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,[1615]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Were it Our Will, We could crumble it to dry pieces, and you would be regretful (or left in wonderment) [Tafsir Ibn Kathîr].
translations.english_rwwad: If We willed, We could reduce your harvest to crumble, leaving you to wonder and lament,

translations.english_saheeh: [Saying], "Indeed, we are [now] in debt;
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Saying): "We are indeed Mughramûn (i.e. ruined or have lost the money without any profit, or are punished by the loss of all that we spend for cultivation)! (Tafsir Al-Qurtubî)
translations.english_rwwad: “We suffered loss,

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, we have been deprived."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Nay, but we are deprived!"
translations.english_rwwad: rather, we are deprived.”

translations.english_saheeh: And have you seen the water that you drink?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then tell Me about the water that you drink.
translations.english_rwwad: Have you thought about the water that you drink?

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنزَلۡتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُزۡنِ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنزِلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is it you who cause it from the rain-clouds to come down, or are We the Causer of it to come down?
translations.english_rwwad: Is it you who bring it down from the clouds, or is it We Who bring it down?

arabic_text: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ جَعَلۡنَٰهُ أُجَاجٗا فَلَوۡلَا تَشۡكُرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?
translations.english_hilali_khan: If We willed, We verily could make it salt (and undrinkable): why then do you not give thanks (to Allâh)?
translations.english_rwwad: If We willed, We could make it salty; will you not then give thanks?

translations.english_saheeh: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then tell Me about the fire which you kindle.
translations.english_rwwad: Have you thought about the fire that you kindle?

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنشَأۡتُمۡ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنشِـُٔونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is it you who made the tree thereof to grow, or are We the Grower?
translations.english_rwwad: Is it you who produced its trees, or is it We Who produced it?

phonetic: 56.73 Naĥnu Ja`alnāhā Tadhkiratan Wa Matā`āan Lilmuqwīna

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1616]- Of the great fire of Hell.
[1617]- In the form of flints or other means by which to ignite fire.  Travelers are mentioned because of the special convenience to them, although it is a provision for all people in general.

translations.english_saheeh: We have made it a reminder[1616] and provision for the travelers,[1617]
translations.english_hilali_khan: We have made it a Reminder (of the Hell-fire in the Hereafter), and an article of use for the travellers (and all the others, in this world).
translations.english_rwwad: We made it a reminder [of the Hellfire] and a benefit for the travelers.

translations.english_saheeh: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then glorify with praises the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.english_rwwad: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1618]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) confirms absolutely by oath.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.56:75) In Arabic Mawâqi‘i An-Nujûm: This word has many interpretations: it may mean the setting or the rising or the mansions of the stars, or the Qur’ân and its gradual revelation in stages. Please see Tafsir At-Tabari for detail..

translations.english_saheeh: Then I swear by the setting of the stars,[1618]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So I swear by the setting of the stars.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: I do swear by the positions of the stars –

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily that is indeed a great oath, if you but know.
translations.english_rwwad: and this is indeed a great oath, if only you knew –

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it is a noble Qur’ān.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That (this) is indeed an honourable recitation (the Noble Qur’ân).
translations.english_rwwad: that this is indeed a noble Qur’an,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1619]- The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ), which is with Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

translations.english_saheeh: In a Register well-protected;[1619].
translations.english_hilali_khan: In a Book well-guarded (with Allâh in the heaven i.e. Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz ).
translations.english_rwwad: in a well-preserved Record,

translations.english_saheeh: None touch it except the purified [i.e., the angels].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Which (that Book with Allâh) none can touch but the purified (i.e. the angels).
translations.english_rwwad: that none can touch except the purified [angels] –

translations.english_saheeh: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: A Revelation (this Qur’ân) from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.english_saheeh: Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is it such a talk (this Qur’ân) that you (disbelievers) deny?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you take this discourse lightly,

translations.english_saheeh: And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And instead (of thanking Allâh) for the provision He gives you, you deny (Him by disbelief)!
translations.english_rwwad: and instead [of thanking Allah] for the provision you are given, you show ingratitude?

translations.english_saheeh: Then why, when it [i.e., the soul at death] reaches the throat
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then why do you not (intervene) when (the soul of a dying person) reaches the throat?
translations.english_rwwad: Then why [you are helpless] when the soul reaches the throat,

translations.english_saheeh: And you are at that time looking on -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you at the moment are looking on,
translations.english_rwwad: while you are looking on,

arabic_text: وَنَحۡنُ أَقۡرَبُ إِلَيۡهِ مِنكُمۡ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُبۡصِرُونَ
phonetic: 56.85 Wa Naĥnu 'Aqrabu 'Ilayhi Minkum Wa Lakin Lā Tubşirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We [i.e., Our angels] are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -
translations.english_hilali_khan: But We (i.e. Our angels who take the soul) are nearer to him than you, but you see not, (Tafsir At-Tabarî)
translations.english_rwwad: when We are closer to him than you, but you do not see?

translations.english_saheeh: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then why do you not - if you are exempt from the reckoning and recompense (punishment) -
translations.english_rwwad: If you are not subject to retribution, then why do you not

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1620]- i.e., return the soul to the body, meaning that just as you cannot prevent death when it is decreed, you will not escape the recompense when it is decreed.

translations.english_saheeh: Bring it back,[1620] if you should be truthful?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Bring back the soul (to its body), if you are truthful?
translations.english_rwwad: bring that [soul] back, if you are truthful?

translations.english_saheeh: And if he [i.e., the deceased] was of those brought near [to Allāh],
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, if he (the dying person) be of the Muqarrabûn (those brought near to Allâh),
translations.english_rwwad: If that dying person is one of those who will be brought near to Allah,

phonetic: 56.89 Farawĥun Wa Rayĥānun Wa Jannatu Na`īmin

translations.english_saheeh: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (There is for him) rest and provision, and a Garden of Delights (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: then [he will have] comfort, fragrance, and Garden of Bliss.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

translations.english_saheeh: And if he was of the companions of the right,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if he (the dying person) be of those on the Right Hand,
translations.english_rwwad: If he is one of the people of the right,

translations.english_saheeh: Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then there is safety and peace (from the Punishment of Allâh) for those on the right Hand.
translations.english_rwwad: [He will be told], “Peace be to you, for being one of the people of the right.”

arabic_text: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

translations.english_saheeh: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,
translations.english_hilali_khan: But if he (the dying person) be of the denying (of the Resurrection), the erring (away from the Right Path of Islâmic Monotheism),
translations.english_rwwad: But if he is one of the misguided deniers,

translations.english_saheeh: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then for him is an entertainment with boiling water.
translations.english_rwwad: then he will be welcomed with scalding water,

translations.english_saheeh: And burning in Hellfire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And burning in Hell-fire.
translations.english_rwwad: and he will burn in Blazing Fire.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, this is the true certainty,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, this! This is an absolute Truth with certainty.
translations.english_rwwad: This is indeed the absolute truth.

translations.english_saheeh: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So glorify with praises the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.english_rwwad: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
